Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
class Board extends Object
Class to implement a Board It has 7 attributes These include an array of Snake objects(pointers) to implement multiple snakes an array of Ladder objects(pointers) to implement multiple ladders 2 int attributes for number of snakes and ladders 2 int attributes for number of rows and columns 1 int attribute for finish position

    • snakeBit

      public int snakeBit​(int p, int n)
      method to find out if a player is bit by a snake and to return his new position position does not change if the player is not bit by a snake
      Parameters:
      p - for getting player position(current)
      n - for getting player number
      Returns:
      p - new position for current player

    • ladderClimbed

      public int ladderClimbed​(int p, int n)
      method to find out if a player climbed a ladder and to return his new position position does not change if the player does not climb a ladder
      Parameters:
      p - for getting player position(current)
      n - for getting player number
      Returns:
      p - new position for current player

    • element

      public String element​(int p)
      method to check if there is an element(snake head, ladder top.. ) at the current position p (and returning a String ) so that it can be displayed on the board
      Parameters:
      p - for getting player position(current)
      Returns:
      s - defines the type of element at the current position

    • playerFinder

      public String playerFinder​(int x, int[] a, int[] b)
      method to check if there is a player at the current position (and returning a String) so that it can be displayed on the board
      Parameters:
      x - for the number on board
      a - for array of positions of all players
      b - for array of orders of all players
      Returns:
      s - string to show the player number at current position

    • display

      public void display​(int[] pp, int[] po)
      method to display the Board object
      Parameters:
      pp - for array of positions of all player
      po - for array of orders of all players
